results.definition: the news as presented by reporters for newspapers or radio or television
examples: they accused the paper of biased coverage of race relations

results.definition: to give an account or representation of in words
examples: Discreet Italian police described it in a manner typically continental

results.definition: announce as the result of an investigation or experience or finding
examples: Dozens of incidents of wife beatings are reported daily in this city
The team reported significant advances in their research
I report to work every day at 9 o'clock
One student reported the other to the principal

results.definition: be responsible for reporting the details of, as in journalism
examples: Snow reported on China in the 1950's
The cub reporter covered New York City

results.definition: complain about; make a charge against
examples: I reported her to the supervisor
